AlphaSignal - Class in org.texgen.textures.signal
AlphaSignal multiplies the alpha channel value of the incoming source texture by a value defined by the alpha signal input.

ChannelSignal - Interface in org.texgen.textures
Channel Signal interface to calculate the double output signal based on the input u,v, values.
ChannelSignal.Channel - Enum in org.texgen.textures
Channel enum used to define which channel a signal applies to if needed in one of the textures.
ChannelSignalTexture - Class in org.texgen.textures.color

O

orange() - Static method in class org.texgen.utils.RGBAColor
 
org.texgen.gui - package org.texgen.gui
Visual UI classes for displaying textures.

To get started with displaying a texture, just use :
TextureViewer.show(new TextureClass(),500,500,"My Texture");
org.texgen.signals - package org.texgen.signals
Set of built-in signal classes that can be used as signal sources.
org.texgen.signals.modifier - package org.texgen.signals.modifier
Signal classes that take a source signal and modify it to produce a new signal
org.texgen.textures - package org.texgen.textures
This package contains the core interfaces and abstract class implementations for textures and signals.
org.texgen.textures.color - package org.texgen.textures.color
Textures that are based on color and shading
org.texgen.textures.complex - package org.texgen.textures.complex
Set of complex textures built up out of other textures
org.texgen.textures.composite - package org.texgen.textures.composite
Textures used to compose multiple textures together based on alpha values or even based on a ChannelSignal value.
org.texgen.textures.demo - package org.texgen.textures.demo
Some demo textures from the how-to articles
org.texgen.textures.pattern - package org.texgen.textures.pattern
Textures which are based on patterns and shapes
org.texgen.textures.signal - package org.texgen.textures.signal
Contains textures which depend on signals for their output
org.texgen.textures.uv - package org.texgen.textures.uv
Textures the modify the U,V inputs and then use those values to call the source texture.
org.texgen.utils - package org.texgen.utils
Contains utility class to be used in textures and signals

TextureMixer - Class in org.texgen.textures.composite
Takes a list of textures and mixes them equally

count = number of textures
result = color(0,0,0,0);

for each texture : result = result + texture.getColor(u,v)
result.scale(1/count);
